monster.name: Bandit Ruffian

trait.name: Strength in Numbers
trait.text: The bandit has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the bandit's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Smoke Bomb
trait.text: As a bonus action, the bandit can deploy a smoke bomb to aid in escaping the fight. The smoke spreads in a circle from the point of impact and fills a 20 ft., radius. The area inside the smoke is considered heavily obscured (PHB pg. 183). Any creature inside is blinded until it exists the smoke.

action.name: Short Sword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
action.text: Ranged weapon attack:+4 to hit, range 80 ft./320 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+2) piercing damage.

monster.description:
The foot-soldier of any bandit gang, they dress in a patchwork of armor and wield weapons looted from the dead.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Bandits & Brigands p. 17 (Third Party)

monster.name: Bandit Heavy

trait.name: Strength in Numbers
trait.text: The bandit has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the bandit's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Human Shield
trait.text: As a reaction when attacked, the bandit heavy can attempt to seize one creature within five feet of them and use it as a shield to absorb the damage of the attack. To do so, the heavy must succeed on a Strength (Athletics) check contested by the target's Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics). If the heavy is successful, the target takes the damage instead of the heavy. The heavy may use an enemy or an ally as their shield. This ability does not work for area of effect damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The heavy makes two melee attacks with its great axe.

action.name: Great Axe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d12+3) slashing damage.

monster.description:
A cut above the common rabble, Bandit heavies are hard-hitting fighters that can deal and take more punishment than most. Big, tough, and better armed than a ruffian, these are powerful forces on the battlefield.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Bandits & Brigands p. 18 (Third Party)

monster.name: Bandit Spellsinger

trait.name: Forced Revelry
trait.text: As an action, the spellsinger hurls a flask at one creature within 30 feet. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 13) or immediately become poisoned (DMG pg. 292) as the strong smell of liquor fills the air.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The spellsinger is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attack).
• Cantrips (at will): Fire Bolt, Light, Mage Hand, Prestidigitation • 1st level (4 slots): Pickpocket*, Mage Armor, Magic Missile, Shield • 2nd level (3 slots): Misty Step, Poisoned Blade* • 3rd level (3 slots): Counterspell, Lemmy's Giant Stride*, Fireball • 4th level (2 slots): Brilliant Flash*, Ice Storm
* Spells from this book.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5ft., or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage.

monster.spells: Fire Bolt, Light, Mage Hand, Prestidigitation, Pickpocket (HB), Mage Armor, Magic Missile, Shield, Misty Step, Poisoned Blade (HB), Counterspell, Lemmy's Giant Stride (HB), Fireball, Brilliant Flash (HB), Ice Storm
monster.description:
Failed students, runaway apprentices, or those kicked out of their magical societies, bandit spellsingers are less skilled than a formal mage, but much tougher. Their skills are highly prized by their gangs, and they are protected as the indispensable resources they are.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Bandits & Brigands p. 19 (Third Party)

monster.name: Bandit Deceiver
monster.skill: Deception +6, Persuasion +6, Acrobatics +7, Sleight of Hand +7

trait.name: Strength in Numbers
trait.text: The bandit has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the bandit's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Fancy Footwork
trait.text: The deceiver can take the dash or disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Pickpocket
trait.text: As a reaction, the bandit deceiver can attempt to pick the pocket of someone it is engaged in combat with. The deceiver makes a Sleight of Hand (Dexterity) check against the target's AC. On a success, they abscond with 3d6 gold from the target's pocket.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The deceiver is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks).
• Cantrips (at will): Friends, Vicious Mockery, Drang's Morning After* • 1st level (4 slots): Charm Person, Invisibility, • 2nd level (3 slots): Poisoned Blade*, Knock
* Spells from this book.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The deceiver makes three attacks: one with a dagger and two with its rapier.

action.name: Rapier
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8+4) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5ft., or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4+4) piercing damage.

monster.spells: Friends, Vicious Mockery, Drang's Morning After (HB), Pickpocket (HB), Charm Person, Friends, Invisibility, Poisoned Blade (HB), Knock
monster.description:
Equally at home at a ball as on a battlefield, the bandit deceiver has a way with words and with blades. They're essential in negotiating surrender and payment terms from the gang's targets, and are adept at defending themselves if those negotiations go wrong.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Bandits & Brigands p. 20 (Third Party)

monster.name: Bandit Captain

trait.name: Tactical Retreat
trait.text: When the captain takes the Disengage action, one allied creature within 30 ft. may also Disengage as a reaction.

action.name: Bandit Commander
action.text: The captain shouts orders or signals to their allies. Each allied creature within 60 feet that can hear or see the captain and is a bandit can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack or move up to half of its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The bandit captain makes three melee attacks, two with its scimitar and one with its dagger.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6+3) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
action.text: Ranged weapon attack: +5 to hit, range 30 ft,.120 ft., one target. Hit 7 (1d6+3) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5ft., or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4+3) piercing damage.

monster.description:
Dressed in finer armor and wielding their weapon with competence, the bandit captain makes a striking figure as they command the field, making order out of chaos.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Bandits & Brigands p. 21 (Third Party)

monster.name: Bandit King
monster.skill: Acrobatics +7, Deception +7, Perception +5, Sleight of Hand +7, Stealth +7

trait.name: Aura of Infamy
trait.text: While within 30 ft. of the bandit king, allied creatures gain +2 to attack rolls and saving throws. Additionally, they advantage on saving throws against being frightened. This aura does not affect lawful aligned-creatures.

trait.name: Master Thief
trait.text: The Bandit King has advantage on Dexterity (Sleight of Hand), Dexterity (Stealth), and Dexterity saving throws against traps and magical effects. Once per turn, when the Bandit King hits a creature with a weapon attack, they can attempt to steal a visible item (such as a pouch, potion or key) with a contested Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check versus the target's Wisdom (Perception).

trait.name: Sneak Attack
trait.text: The bandit king deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage when they hit with a finesse or ranged weapon and have advantage on the attack roll, or if an ally is within 5 ft. of the target and isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The bandit king makes three attacks, two with his scimitar and one with his dagger or shortbow.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6+4) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6+4) piercing damage.

action.name: Command the Crew
action.text: The bandit king calls out to their allies. Up to three allied bandits within 60 feet that can hear the king may immediately move up to half their speed and make one weapon attack as a reaction.

reaction.name: Opportunity Strike
reaction.text: When a creature within 5 ft. of the bandit king is hit by an attack from another creature, the king can make one melee weapon attack against the attacker.

monster.description:
It takes a person with an iron will and a silver tongue to keep a group of bandits in line — and the bandit king has all of this and more. Strong fighters, bandit kings, thrive on battlefields where they seize command and lead their troops directly to victory.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Bandits & Brigands p. 22 (Third Party)
